body:
> @daiyunqing您的参数错误。
> 请参阅：[https](https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/legacy/4.x/document/cn/manual/sharding-scaling/usage/) : [//shardingsphere.apache.org/document/legacy/4.x/document/cn/manual/sharding-scaling/usage/](https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/legacy/4.x/document/cn/manual/sharding-scaling/usage/)

@Lucas-307 
The parameter initiated by the  Sharding-Ui 4.1.0 data scaling menu,
Problem has been solved！
Problem has been solved！

Hi @tristaZero, @wgy8283335 I've added SQL definition for `MERGE`. Here is the [documentation](https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/19/sqlrf/MERGE.html#GUID-5692CCB7-24D9-4C0E-81A7-A22436DC968F).

@tristaZero, I'm getting `line 1:0 no viable alternative at input 'MERGE'` when running `OracleParserParameterizedTest`. I searched for this issue for the past few days and couldn't able to solve it. There are no issues when testing the `merge` rule with ANTLR plugin in IntelliJ.

> @zht0209 Could you pleace give me more detail to reproduce it.
> I don't know why this case happen.

During incremental migration, when Placeholder Record is greater than 1024, a DataRecord comes in at this time, startIndex will be changed to 1024, and the fromIndex of fetchRecords is 0, so correctIndex will become a negative number
Done.

> Conflicts?

I've resolve the confilcts.

Hi @huosenyuan ,

Thanks for debugging.
Is there any data in `t_job0` and `t_job1`? Looks like we need to figure out why we get null from `statement.getResultSet()`.

Hi, 

What you said is `getGeneratedKeys()` from `preparedStatement`?
Which version is running in your env?

Hi @wzdlagrange ,

I suggest you try 5.0.0-alpha in your case. 5.0.0-alpha helps users manage these none-sharding tables. Still, SQL parsing is the process of handing any SQLs (Just for judging table type) but there is no rewriting or something.

From 5.x version, ShardingSphere will focus on helping users manage all the tables. For instance, many of the none-sharing tables will be automatically loaded. Consequently, users utilize it in the way they use a database.
Can not support hsqldb
@kindess Can you tell the reason for close issue?
Cloud you try to version 5.0.0-alpha?
No response
No response

`t_job0` and `t_job1` has data; 
`List<QueryResult> queryResults = executeQuery0(); ` has result;  after The result set in statement has been cleared；
so
`statement.getResultSet() ` statement does not query results
It has been fixed by 5.0.0-alpha ..
No response
@daiyunqing You can try to update your rule config.
@messi2094 What version do you use?

The document is going on about mix configuration.
Please follow #9286
please assign to me
No response
@odyssey1816 The `case ... when ...` statement is already supported in the latest `5.0.0-alpha` version, you can upgrade to the latest version. 😊
@tristaZero springboot 2.3.4 + sharding-jdbc-spring-boot-starter 4.1.1。But, how to use or how to configure ? I have not find  way for returning to the primary key
Do you resolve the issue?
@terrymanu @AllrenGao It has been fixed by 5.0.0.

@Lucas-307 The source  rule config only read-write separation. new rule config is  read-write separation and  table sharding 。
**Configuration is as follows：**


**source rule config:**

schemaName: global_market
dataSources:
  master0:
    url: jdbc:mysql://**:3306/global_market?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF-8&serverTimezone=UTC
    username: root
    password: root
    connectionTimeoutMilliseconds: 30000
    idleTimeoutMilliseconds: 60000
    maxLifetimeMilliseconds: 1800000
    maxPoolSize: 50
  slave0:
    url: jdbc:mysql://**:3306/global_market?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF-8&serverTimezone=UTC
    username: root
    password: root
    connectionTimeoutMilliseconds: 30000
    idleTimeoutMilliseconds: 60000
    maxLifetimeMilliseconds: 1800000
    maxPoolSize: 50

masterSlaveRule:
  name: global_market
  masterDataSourceName: master0
  slaveDataSourceNames: 
    - slave0 


**new dataBase rule config:**

schemaName: global_market_master0

dataSources:
  master0:
    url: jdbc:mysql://**:3306/global_market?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF-8&serverTimezone=UTC
    username: root
    password: root
    connectionTimeoutMilliseconds: 30000
    idleTimeoutMilliseconds: 60000
    maxLifetimeMilliseconds: 1800000
    maxPoolSize: 50
  slave0:
    url: jdbc:mysql://**:3306/global_market?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF-8&serverTimezone=UTC
    username: root
    password: root
    connectionTimeoutMilliseconds: 30000
    idleTimeoutMilliseconds: 60000
    maxLifetimeMilliseconds: 1800000
    maxPoolSize: 50

masterSlaveRule:
  name: global_market_master0
  masterDataSourceName: master0
  slaveDataSourceNames:
      - slave0
shardingRule:
tables:
    t_coupon:
      actualDataNodes: global_market_master0.t_coupon_${0..1}
      tableStrategy:
        inline:
          shardingColumn: user_id
          algorithmExpression: t_coupon_${user_id % 2}

I got it. 
when fromIndex < startIndex, may be correctIndex = 0 is better.
```
int correctIndex = fromIndex < startIndex ? 0 : (int) (fromIndex - startIndex);
```
#9112 #9119 has fixed it.

> Do you resolve the issue?

Manually set the primary key effective
#8116 has fixed it.

Hi ~ @zhang-j-x  ! Thanks for your feedback!
In fact, datasource.names is a logical database name, which can be inconsistent with the actual database name.
Do you also report an error in the url when you use "_"?

> i know the cache, but when i test it ,i use “engine.parse(sql, false);” ，this means parser engine des't use cache. right ?

Yes.

Thank you.I get it.
I'll try.
@daiyunqing You can try to use `curl`  command to create a http request. Just like document's example.

> Cloud you try to version 5.0.0-alpha?

ok,but we prefer a lower stable version to a higher alpha version. Could you please give me an  approximate time that a stable version of shardingsphere release?I think so many devs are waiting for it :)
@Lucas-307 all right thank u happy Chinese New Year.

@tristaZero I've attached the image of the exception for your consideration. 

![exceptionMerge](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48581379/107142753-12001a80-6957-11eb-91b4-f9a8b47ed79b.png)

Hi @huanghao495430759 ,

Thanks for your PR. There are some comments to review.

Hi @maxh4 ,

Do you mean `SpringBootConfiguration` of ShardingSphere has conflicts with Spring framework or others?

Hi @tristaZero ,

I didn't mean any conflicts. Just a naming strategy suggestion.

My project is in this structure:
|-RootProject
  \-CommonModule
  \-ServiceModule1
  \-ServiceModule2

ServiceModules are all referencing the CommonModule, so that I can extract some common configurations to avoid redundant code.
Then I also need to write some tests in each module, so I have excluded the auto-configuration classes for features in Common, then import back in ServiceModules. This can start spring and run tests without configuration properties declared in the yaml file.

For other AutoConfiguration classes from the features I used, they are naming like:
SecurityAutoConfiguration.class,
DruidDataSourceAutoConfigure.class,
DataSourceAutoConfiguration.class,
RabbitAutoConfiguration.class

So here I suggest renaming the sharding sphere data source auto-configuration boot class to avoid confusions.

Hi, 

Could you do some search on `getGeneratedKeys()` by Springboot?
Springboot just helps users manage the data sources, and I guess there is some interface calling `getGeneratedKeys()` of `preparedStatement` to return all the generated keys. 
Suppose you want to try the original `getGeneratedKeys()` of `preparedStatement`, you can write a demo to call this function from `ShardingSphereDataSource`. 

That way will help us figure out whether SS has a bug on this function or just a usage issue.

Hi @huosenyuan ,

> List<QueryResult> queryResults = executeQuery0(); has result; after The result set in statement has been cleared；

Thanks for feedback.
Who did clear this `List<QueryResult>`? I just wanna figure out this SS's bug or not.

> Can not support hsqldb

I suppose so, but I am a little confused that why this exception came there.
@daiyunqing You are welcome.

@Lucas-307 Still not resolved,error message :{"success":false,"errorCode":500,"errorMsg":"Cannot create property=masterDataSourceName for JavaBean=org.apache.shardingsphere.core.yaml.config.sharding.YamlShardingRuleConfiguration@3282b36f
 in 'string', line 1, column 1:
    masterDataSourceName: ds0
    ^
Unable to find property 'masterDataSourceName' on class: **org.apache.shardingsphere.core.yaml.config.sharding.YamlShardingRuleConfiguration
 in 'string', line 1, column 23:
    masterDataSourceName: ds0
**                          ^
","model":null}
Too many submitted files, so split and close the current PR.
Hi @tristaZero, I've tried to add some files to run test cases successfully. Can you please check it?

OK，thanks

please assign to me

Hi @ThanoshanMV,

Sorry for no review or feedback on this PR so far.
Since these days are the Chinese spring festival, I suppose many of the  contributors from China finally have time spending with their family. Let us leave them some time for that.
For me, the test assertion and new SQLStatement looks good.
Hi @wgy8283335  @jingshanglu guys,  we are waiting for your comeback.
 
Have a good day. : )

Hi @tristaZero,

Happy Spring Festival to you and other contributors from China!

Have a nice day and enjoy your festival with your family :)

> ShardingSphere-Proxy or ShardingSphere-JDBC?
> 
> Can you give a proof that you use PreparedStatement in this scenario?

I use the ShardingSphere-JDBC.   I have made a test for testing speed of version 3.1 and speed of version 4.1.1.

test method:  use the same select sql to test the speed of different version, such as : select * from `order_history` where order_id = ? and symbol = ? and user_id = ?

monitor method:  monitor each method cost time in stacktrace by using aspectj load time weaver in spring boot

monitor log example:  sharding-monitor|io.shardingsphere.shardingjdbc.jdbc.adapter.AbstractShardingPreparedStatementAdapter|getParameters|0
the column 1 is just a header,   the column 2 is target class,   the column 3 is invoke method,  the column 4 is cost time  (time unit is MICROSECONDS)

the test result:  the phase "sqlRoute" of version 3.1 is always 1-1.5 milliseconds(1000 MICROSECONDS - 1500MICROSECONDS) faster than the phase "prepare" of version 4.1.1.  
version 3.1:  sharding-monitor|io.shardingsphere.shardingjdbc.jdbc.core.statement.ShardingPreparedStatement|sqlRoute|850
version 4.1.1:  sharding-monitor|org.apache.shardingsphere.shardingjdbc.jdbc.core.statement.ShardingPreparedStatement|prepare|2062
I think these two phases have the same funtions: parse, rewrite, route,  so compare them.

the monitor log is in attachment, you can check it.
[version3.1-sqlroute-log.txt](https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/files/5982522/version3.1-sqlroute-log.txt)
[version4.1.1-prepare-log.txt](https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/files/5982523/version4.1.1-prepare-log.txt)

So I insist because the class structure of version 4.11 is more complicated than version 3.1,  cost more time. @tuohai666

> What is the SQL about fulltext search?

is this sql:

select * from table where MATCH(trade_user_white_list) AGAINST(CAST('#{userId,jdbcType=BIGINT}' AS CHAR) IN BOOLEAN MODE)

thank you for help

it is that your table-strategy is according to your `month` column in your configuration. The month list in query is `202001,202002,201901`,  and will map to your table of `trainee_checkin_checkout_1` and `trainee_checkin_checkout_2`
